description: Number of k, 1 <= k <= n, such that GCD(n,k) = GCD(n+1,k) = 1.
comments: Number of numbers between 1 and n-1 coprime to n(n+1).It is conjectured that every positive integer appears. - _Jon Perry_, Dec 12 2002a(A000040(n)-1)=A000010(A000040(n)-1); a(A000040(n))=A000010(A000040(n)+1)-1; = a(A118854(n)-1)=a(A118854(n)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 02 2006
example: a(8) = 3 because 1, 5 and 7 are all relatively prime to both 8 and 9.a(9) counts those numbers coprime to 90, i.e. 1 and 7, hence a(9)=2
mathematica: f[ n_ ] := Length @ Select[ Range[ n ], GCD[ n, # ] == GCD[ n + 1, # ] == 1 & ]; Table[ f[ n ], {n, 80} ] (* _Ray Chandler_, Dec 06 2006 *)
prog: (PARI) newphi(v)=local(vl,fl,np); vl=length(v); np=0; for (s=1,v[1],fl=false; for (r=1,vl,if (gcd(s,v[r])>1,fl=true; break)); if (fl==false,np++)); np v=vector(2); for (i=1,500,v[1]=i; v[2]=i+1; print1(newphi(v)","))
author: _Leroy Quet_, Sep 27 2000
